column1: Explain how the four basic tissue types contribute to the structure and function of organs in the human body.
Explain how the composition and proportions of the extracellular matrix (ECM) influence the physical properties of different types of connective tissue.
Describe how the different components of connective tissue contribute to its overall structure and function.
Explain how lymph nodes help protect the body from disease and infection.
Explain how the components of connective tissue contribute to the differences in characteristics and functions among various connective tissue types.
Summarize the main differences between loose (areolar) connective tissue and dense connective tissue in terms of structure and function.
Describe how the structure and composition of cartilage enable it to provide support to soft tissues while withstanding compressive forces.
Explain how the organic and inorganic components of bone matrix contribute to the overall strength and function of bone.
Explain the relationship between cells, tissues, and organs in the human body, and describe the role of the four basic tissue types.
Describe how the composition and structure of the extracellular matrix (ECM) influence the properties and functions of different types of connective tissue.
Describe how the specific components of connective tissue—protein fibres, ground substance, adhesive glycoproteins, and tissue fluid—contribute to its overall structure and function.
Explain the role of lymph nodes in preventing the spread of disease and infection within the body.
Explain how the composition of cells, protein fibres, and ground substance contributes to the characteristics and functions of different connective tissue types.
Describe the main differences between loose (areolar) connective tissue and dense connective tissue in terms of their structure and functions.
Describe the key structural and functional characteristics of cartilage and explain how its extracellular matrix contributes to its ability to withstand compressive forces.
Explain how the organic and inorganic components of bone matrix contribute to the overall strength and function of bone.

Describe the roles of the organic and inorganic components of the bone matrix and explain how their properties contribute to the overall function of bone.
